items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

1. Position Management

Tutoring Center Coordinator, 100% FTE, (7MASC0222C) in Math & Science at San Jose City College effective 07/01/15.
	 
c. Job Description Revision
	 
See attached job description.
	 
2. Employment
	 
a. New Hire
	 
Groundskeeper II, 100% FTE, (8GRDS0204C) in the Grounds Department at Evergreen Valley College effective 04/20/15.
	 
Outreach/Recruitment Specialist, 100% FTE, (8TRIO0202C) in Enrollment Services (Talent Search) at Evergreen Valley College effective 04/20/15.

Outreach/Recruitment Specialist, 100% FTE, (8TRIO0203C) in Enrollment Services(Talent Search) at Evergreen Valley College effective 04/13/15.
	 
3. Change of Status
	 
a. Reclassification
	 
Reclassification process per the CSEA CBA Chapter 363 Article 23.1 and Article 23.3 "Reclassification will become effective July 1 of the year following the reclassification request."
	 
b. Working Out of Class
	 
The employee is working out of class as Network Engineer, 100% FTE, (9ITSS0232C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office effective 04/29/15 through 06/30/15.
	 
The employee is working out of class as Adaptive Media Technician Specialist I, 100% FTE, (8DSPS0214C) in the DSPS Department at Evergreen Valley College effective 01/01/15 through 06/30/15.
	 
The employee is working out of class as Senior Systems Administrator, 100% FTE, (9ITSS0227C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office effective 05/01/15 through 06/30/15. 
	 
c. Promotion
	 
The employee is promoted to Senior Systems Administrator, 100% FTE, (9ITSS0330C) in the ITSS Department at the District Office from Systems Administrator, 100% FTE, (7CTSS0210C) in the CTSS Department at San Jose City College effective 05/01/15.
	 
d. Temporary Increase to Work Schedule
	 
Employee's work schedule is temporarily increased from 75% FTE, (7COSM0212C) to 100% FTE, (7COSM0211C) in the Cosmetology Department at San Jose City College effective 03/02/15 through 06/30/15.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
The curriculum proposals have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC) acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new recommendation has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear need not being served by existing curriculum.
	 
The proposed courses cover the interrelatedness of addiction and criminality. The double subject listing is intended to allow those with expertise from either discipline to teach the classes.
	 
Certificate:
Alcohol and Drug Studies: Addiction and Criminal Justice Certificate of Specialization
	 
Courses:
ADS 080: Addiction in the Criminal Justice Population
AJ 080: Addiction in the Criminal Justice Population
ADS 081: Criminal Justice Process for the Addicted Offender
AJ 081: Criminal Justice Process for the Addicted Offender
ADS 082: Co-occurring Disorders in the Addicted Offender Population
AJ 082: Co-occurring Disorders in the Addicted Offender Population
ADS 083: Treatment and Interventions for the Addicted Offender
AJ 083: Treatment and Interventions for the Addicted Offender

items.item_details: The Special Programs Grant includes the development of nursing students to improve their marketability for employment in a RNSA area.  This includes (but not limited to) the development of a sustainable ADN to BSN Bridge Program for the third semester nursing students (Fall 2015).  Dr. Antoinette Herrera presented a summary of the RFP for the grant to EVC College Council on February 9, 2015.  Dr. Herrera collaborated with Dr. Deepika Goya from SJSU, President Henry Yong and VP Keith Aytch in support of this RFA.  In 2007, with funds from the State Chancellorâs Office, EVC successfully piloted this program with SJSU.  EVC is looking forward to a continued collaboration.  An MOU is being drafted by SJSU and will be submitted to the Board of Trustees once completed.  The Song Brown Training Act supports growth in Registered Nursing Shortage areas of which Santa Clara County is a designated RNSA area. A presentation by Dr. Herrera and Dr. Goyal from SJSU was given on this grant application on March 4, 2015 in Sacramento California.    The award letter was received on March 19, 2015 for $124,999 for the period of July 1, 2015 through June 30, 2017. No matching funds are required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the California Office of Statewide Health Planning & Development Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Special Programs in the amount of $125,000 for Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Acceptance of Grant Funds - Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Special Programs - Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 6. Acceptance of Grant Funds - Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Special Programs - Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details: Capitation Funding is to support the costs (including faculty, support services, etc.) associated with educating full time RN pre licensure students.  The Song Brown Training Act supports growth in Registered Nursing Shortage areas of which Santa Clara County is a designated RNSA area.  Dr. Antoinette Herrera presented a summary of the grant to EVC College Council on February 9, 2015.  Dr. Herrera presented the grant to Song Brown in Sacramento on March 4, 2015. The award letter was received on March 19, 2015 for $40,000.00.  No matching funds are required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the California Office of Statewide Health Planning & Development Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Capitation Funding in the amount of $40,000.
items.item_text: Acceptance of Grant Funds - Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Capitation Funding
items.item_text_raw: 7. Acceptance of Grant Funds - Song Brown Health Care Workforce Training Act Capitation Funding

items.item_details: The purpose of this grant is to sustain and strengthen certified nursing and home health aide training programs at California Community Colleges.  Grants are awarded to programs providing quality entry level healthcare training for students, thereby creating economic opportunity for individuals, as well as increasing the availability of CNAs and HHAs in California communities demonstrating a critical need in the workforce.  This grant will be used for instructional support, student scholarships and emergency assistance, equipment/supplies and curriculum development. Dr. Antoinette Herrera presented a summary of the RFP for the grant to EVC College Council on February 9, 2015.  We received the award letter on March 18, 2015 for $55,000 for the period of July 1, 2015 through June 30, 2016.  No matching funds are required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the 2015 Dorothy D. Rupe Nursing Assistant Grant funds in the amount of $55,000 for Evergreen Valley College from the Arthur N. Rupe Foundation.

items.item_details:
J.E.W.L. INC., Oral History and Learning Institute/Museum brings the communities to Evergreen Valley College campus and the campus to the communities with the regularly held events along with the extensive collection of rare and well known histories and Social Justice work. The extensive collection consists of historical books, photos, documents, Oral Histories, music, historical items and other information.
	 
Students use both the Institute and Museum for their research papers, as well as discussions with the Director and other informative individuals that can provide first-hand information about their research topics. Tours are successfully conducted for visitors on a regular basis.
	 
Several major documents have been produced at Evergreen Valley College through the work of J.E.W.L. in collaboration with the Coalition of Concerned Citizens and Organizations such as: 
AB1493 Robynâs Law (the only Bill named after an African-American child).
Santa Clara County Public Defendersâ Office document to protect minors from being interrogated by law enforcement without their parent or legal advisor.
The Resolution signed by Santa Clara County Board of Supervisors setting a standard against the use of the N-Word and other racial epithets to be used in schools, city, law enforcement and all government offices in Santa Clara County.
The Historical case, Jena Six, an extensive Teach-In and Brief put together by experts and filed with the Supreme Court of Louisiana. DeAnza College participated on EVC campus.
J.E.W.L. hopes and desires to continue in the collaboration with Evergreen Valley College in a unique and one of a kind united effort to promote education, social justice, awareness, economic empowerment, pride in cultural heritage and humanity.
	 
The term of this Memorandum of Understanding shall be from July 1, 2015 through June 30, 2016.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Memorandum of Understanding between Evergreen Valley College and J.E.W.L, Inc.
items.item_text: Memorandum of Understanding between Evergreen Valley College and J.E.W.L. Inc.

items.item_details: At the April 14, 2015, Governing Board Meeting, the Board approved its committees for 2015. The Board also added two committees, Board Legislative and Board Self-Evaluation, as Standing Committees of the Board. Therefore, the Governing Principle: Board Committee Structure has been revised so that all three standing committees of the Board are included in this principle.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Board Ends Policies and Governance Principles document to reflect the changes made to Governing Principle Board Committee Structure.

items.item_details:
This agenda item is for Phase 2 of the network configuration and migration services at the new District Office for the new CENIC network connections. The Statement of Work includes project management, installation and configuration of firewalls, routers, switches and VOIP phone system to work with the new CENIC Internet and Wide Area Network connections to be installed at the new DO, SJCC and EVC. The completion of this work is dependent upon the completion of the new CENIC network connections (TBD). Currently, the two scheduling windows are planned for Memorial Day weekend or July 4th weekend and this will require some work to occur outside of normal business hours.
	 
The ICA is based on RFP # G2010.0099 and pursuant to the Master Agreement with Dasher Technologies approved by the Board on 8/26/14 (Measure G-2010 Bond Program).
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) for Phase 2 of the District Office network installation and migration from the old District Office per the attached ICA and Statement of Work with Dasher Technologies for a total cost not to exceed $141,250.

items.item_details: The attached resolution in support of the Black Lives Matter Movement and the call to fairness in the criminal justice system has been submitted by the AFT 6157. It is, therefore, recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution in solidarity and as an expression of its support.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 042815-1 in Support of the “Black Lives Matter” Movement And Fairness in the Criminal Justice System

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
On April 7, 2015, the Workforce Institute received notice from Work2Future that the WIA funding contract for the 2015-2016 program year will not be renewed due to the replacement of the Workforce Investment Act (WIA) by the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA).  As a result of the contract not being renewed, the action of position elimination due to lack of funds/lack of work needs to be taken.
	 
Therefore, the Chancellor recommends that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 042815-2, Eliminate Positions and Layoff Classified Employees, and authorize the District representatives to provide all affected employees with sixty (60) day notices of layoff.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 042815-2 Eliminate Postions and Layoff Classified Employees.

items.item_details:
The Districtâs financing team will be presenting information on the issuance of the refunding of prior general obligation bonds.
	 
The refunding of outstanding prior bonds is expected not to exceed $100 million in aggregate principal amount.  All benefits from the refunding will be delivered to the property owners in the District in the form of lower property tax bills. 
	 
A draft Resolution, accompanying draft agenda item for the Resolution, Preliminary Official Statement, Escrow Agreement, and Contract of Purchase for the refunding have been included for Board review.  The final resolution and associated documents will be brought to the Board of Trustees for approval on May 12, 2015.
	 
The next steps toward issuance of the refunding bonds are as follows:
	 
May 12, 2015: Board of Trustees meeting to approve resolution and form of other legal documents
	 
May 14, 2015: Presentations to bond credit rating agencies
	 
June 3-4, 2015: Pre-sale and sale activities
	 
June 25, 2015: Closing of refinancing
items.item_text: Overview of 2015 General Obligation Refunding Bonds
items.item_text_raw: 3. Overview of 2015 General Obligation Refunding Bonds

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
	 
	The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
	 
	1. To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
	 
	2. To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
